TrcCommonLib.trclib

Class TrcEnhancedServo

  • java.lang.Object
    • TrcCommonLib.trclib.TrcEnhancedServo

  • public class TrcEnhancedServo
extends java.lang.Object
    This class implements a platform independent Enhanced servo. An enhanced servo is a servo with enhanced features. The enhanced servo supports both normal servo as well as continuous servo. It supports limit switches for the continuous servo just like TrcMotor. It also supports lower and upper limit switches for range calibrating a regular servo. It simulates a speed controlled motor with a regular servo. It does this by stepping the servo with different step rate to make it seemed to be speed controlled. It also supports doubling two servos to handle bigger load as a single servo, equivalent to connecting two servos with a Y splitter cable except doing it with software instead.

        Parameters:
        instanceName - specifies the instance name.

        servo1 - specifies the first physical servo object.

        upperLimitSwitch - specifies the high limit switch object.

    • Method Detail

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        This method returns the instance name.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        instance name.

      • rangeCalibrate

        public void rangeCalibrate(double physicalRangeMin,
                           double physicalRangeMax,
                           double stepRate)
        This method performs range calibration on a regular servo.
        Parameters:
        physicalRangeMin - specifies the desired physical range minimum (typically 0.0).
        physicalRangeMax - specifies the desired physical range maximum (typically 180.0).
        stepRate - specifies the step rate to use for the calibration (physicalPos/sec).

      • stop

        public void stop()
        This method stops the servo.

      • getEncoderPosition

        public double getEncoderPosition()
        Uses the getPosition of the servo1, in case there's an encoder.
        Returns:
        The position of servo1. This is different from getPosition in the case of servo1 having an encoder.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if servo1 doesn't support encoders.

      • getPosition

        public double getPosition()
        This method returns the target position set by setPosition.
        Returns:
        target position.

      • setPosition

        public void setPosition(double position,
                        double timeout,
                        TrcEvent event)
        This method sets the servo position. If an event is given, it sets the event after the given amount of time has passed.
        Parameters:
        position - specifies the position to set.
        timeout - specifies a maximum time value the operation should be completed in seconds.
        event - specifies an event object to signal when the timeout event has expired.

      • setPosition

        public void setPosition(double position)
        This method sets the servo position.
        Parameters:
        position - specifies the position to set.

      • setPosition

        public void setPosition(double position,
                        double stepRate)
        This method sets the servo to the specifies position but with the specified step rate in effect controlling the speed to get there.
        Parameters:
        position - specifies the target position.
        stepRate - specifies the stepping rate to get there (physicalPos/sec).

      • setStepMode

        public void setStepMode(double maxStepRate,
                        double minPos,
                        double maxPos)
        This method sets the stepping mode characteristics.
        Parameters:
        maxStepRate - specifies the maximum stepping rate (physicalPos/sec).
        minPos - specifies the minimum position.
        maxPos - specifies the maximum position.

      • setPower

        public void setPower(double power)
        This method sets the power just like a regular motor but for a servo. If it is a continuous servo, it will set it running with different speed. If it is a regular servo, it will change its step rate.
        Parameters:
        power - specifies how fast the servo will turn.

      • getPower

        public double getPower()
        This method returns the last set power value.
        Returns:
        last power set to the motor.
